citation.article-title: Isolation of the anaerobic thermoacidophilic crenarchaeote Acidilobus saccharovorans sp. nov. and proposal of Acidilobales ord. nov., including Acidilobaceae fam. nov. and Caldisphaeraceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Acidilobaceae (A.ci.di.lo.ba.ce′a.e. N.L. masc. n. Acidilobus the type genus of the family, suff. -aceae ending denoting a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Acidilobaceae the family of Acidilobus).
Cells are regular to irregular cocci, 1–2 μm in diameter.
Organotrophic, able to use carbohydrates and peptides.
Hydrogen is not formed even in the absence of electron acceptors.
Growth is stimulated by the presence of elemental sulfur.
Resistant to chloramphenicol, penicillin and streptomycin.
Habitats are acidic terrestrial hot springs.
The type genus is Acidilobus Prokofeva et al. 2000.
